"New Features {added marginTop} ======================
* **Added Stage channels.** Do you host big, online events? Run panels for industry professionals? Do podcasts? Like to talk about something you're passionate about for hours straight while your audience looks on in horror? Large servers with the Community setting enabled now have access to Stage channels. These are special voice channels that mimic the feeling talking in front of an audience, with built in Q&A and moderation features.
* **Easy Server Templates are here.** It's like Discord 2. We can admit, this app can be overwhelming for new folks. You may have tried to get your study group to start a server but they took two lefts, a right, refused to pull over and ask for directions, drove past McDonald's without stopping, and ended up stuck in User Settings. So we've added a way to quickly set up a server without having to go through all the trouble.
* **Servers can now support multiple voice regions.** Before, a server admin could only set one region for the entire server. Now, you can set it *per voice channel.* * By default, all voice channel regions are set to automatic, which will determine the region based on the first person that joins an empty voice channel. * Admins can change the region for each voice channel under Voice Channel Settings > Region Override.
* **New slash commands for bots!** Performing actions with bots is easier than ever. Bot developers—when they're ready, please don't scare them—can have a list of commands available for their bots accessible by the forwardslash key (/). You won't have to remember bot commands anymore and get laughed at when you get the command wrong :( !help…..!help….please
* **Added use Slash Commands permission.** If you run a server, make sure to configure this permission for your bot channels. Bots that upgrade to Slash Commands require this permission.
* **Accessibility settings have moved.** Accessibility now has a dedicated tab in User Settings. Small wins for important features <3
* **You can now enjoy Reduced Motion.** Toggle this on or off under User Settings > Accessibility and keep Discord from making you queasy.
"

"Hey. It's me, Discord. {added marginTop} ======================
So. We're changing our brand look.
Discord was made for people who play games, for those people to connect while they made memories doing what they loved. We've since grown, housing all types of people and communities with such varied interests that it was time we reflected on how our simple app, originally made by seven people in an office with seven mismatched desks in 2015, has genuinely changed people's lives.
It's been six years since then, and we need a bit of a visual update. New logo, new font, new colors, but still Discord.
A little secret: our old logo wasn't even symmetrical. No, seriously. Both the top and bottom of our old logo were totally wonky to a keen eye. Which in a way was charming, but mostly embarrassing.
And not only was our logo secretly messed up, but over time as we grew, we realized it was more of an enigma. *What even was it?* We asked people who were new to Discord and heard answers like gaming controller, pig snout, Mickey Mouse pants and…ugly :(
And they weren't wrong. It was hard to nail down what it represented besides just…Discord, and in a way, gaming.
But it's ours, and it's distinct, so we're keeping it. Kinda. We're buffing out the imperfections and making our weird, pig-snout-Mickey-Mouse controller a bit friendlier for everyone, no matter your interests.
But mostly, we're changing because the countless unique communities on Discord inspired us to change. We worked with a bunch of these communities and people to create our new look, which you can read more about **[here](https://dis.gd/ournewlook)**.
Guess you can say we're growing up a bit. Which is lame for a brand to say. But we're grateful for the people who stuck with us for the last six years, and we're excited to welcome the newcomers in the next six years with a bit of a facelift.
Love, Discord
"
